comment: He is pretty laid back in class. His lectures are fine, he likes to talk about himself. His rubrics are clear. He is very strict about word count, including going over it. The assignments are fairly simple, just set aside an appropriate amount of time to get the work done.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Make English as easy as possible. Take him.

Pretty good, engl 1102 is a single research topic you will choose and use for the entire semester. grades include research proposal rough draft, research proposal, research paper rough draft, research paper final. does as much as he can within the KSU grading guidelines.

At the start of the class, he was such a tough grader and his feedback was not at all helpful. Once I met with him outside class and showed that I cared about my grade, he gave good and helpful feedback on everything after that. He also will call you out if you even pick up your phone so be careful about that.
rating_tags: Participation matters--So many papers--Accessible outside class

comment: I didn't vibe very well with Professor Greene however that doesn't mean he's a bad teacher, in fact he's a great teacher. He gives great feedback and tells people exactly what they need to work on. Be warned he's very anti-phone and will occasionally call on people randomly.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: He is a very good professor. He might talk to much but his work is very easy and is not a bad grader. Attendance is Mandatory!! But if I would like to take this class again I will!

ENGL 1102 Grades depend on attendance, with a very clear grading criteria for essays and weekly assignment that helps essay preparation. Great feedback on all assignments. Follow rubrics and in-class advice for an easy A. Participation matters since sometimes there's partner activities. Overall chill professor, would recommend for everyone.

Prof. Greene cares a lot about his students. He gives great criticism on papers. Be prepared for peer reviews and attendance MATTERS. participation credit is taken 5-10 minutes in the beginning of class. If something comes up, let him know and he will communicate fast in email. He'll always try to work things out.
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: English 1102. He's very understanding and helps you work around conflicts if you tell him. Lots of extra credit given especially at end of semester, but only if you come to class! He wants you to get a good grade and will work with you. Not a hard class and not a lot of homework, but be thorough with the work he does give, it'll help your grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT
